hints.content:
A rectangle with $\blueE5$ same-size rows looks like this:

![A rectangle with horizontal lines dividing it into 5 equal rows. The rows are labeled 1 through 5.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3926211f26b3896fbb15d02bd27f8af95cc63468)

A rectangle with $\maroonD2$ same-size columns looks like this:

![A rectangle with a vertical line dividing it into 2 equal columns. The columns are labeled 1 and 2 at the top.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/319f6096badfcc6fb2f31ae1757eaad68927c3d8)
Which rectangle shows $\blueE5$ rows and $\maroonD2$ columns of same-size squares?

This rectangle shows $\blueE5$ rows and $\maroonD2$  columns of same-size squares:

![A rectangle divided into 10 equal squares in 5 rows and 2 columns.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/65388d8a6b35315241d7f6d660762e1b99c0d30e)

question.content:
**Which rectangle is split into $5$ rows with $2$ columns of same-size squares?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A rectangle divided into 10 equal squares in 2 columns.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/65388d8a6b35315241d7f6d660762e1b99c0d30e)
![A rectangle divided into 12 equal squares in 3 columns.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/40510f3720447439cea7fb8599de92a95e3bcbd5)
